page.title: 02HISTORY OF THE AREA
page.content: All of this area was owned by Glastonbury Abbey from the 7th Century to 1539. The village of West Pennard was part of a manor that was given to the Abbey by King Ealdred. Thus,instead of being ruled by a lord, the manor was ruled by the Abbot.In the original Domesday survey (1086) West Pennard was included under East Pennard which is situated about 4km away on the east side of Pennard hill. The manor continued in the possession of the Abbey until the dissolution of the monasteries in 1539 when it was seized by the crown. Later it was granted to the first Duke of Somerset. The same thing happened to Norwood Park which is in the west of our area. The original Norwood Park was a rural retreat, owned and enjoyed by the Abbots of Glastonbury.
